question:
India launched its first ever maritime communication services in September. Consider the following statements in this context:
  1. The service will be available only to the Indian naval vessels.
  2. The service will provide access to broadband internet in the Indian Ocean.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The maritime communication service is being provided by the TATA group’s Nelco. This is to serve all maritime vessels- both domestic and international- sailing in the Indian waters. The increased connectivity is expected to improve the operational efficiency of energy, cargo and cruise vessels in the region.  Statement 2 is correct: The service will enable access to broadband internet on-board the maritime vessels passing through the Indian waters. The service is being provided with the help of global partnerships and infrastructure including ISRO satellites. The initiative will also provide a ‘bouquet of digital services’ to meet the communication requirements of the maritime sector.
